headline.main: Notes on People; Rizzo's House Undergoes Extensive Improvement

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: HEALTH EDUCATION AND WELFARE, DEPARTMENT OF

results.snippet: The $90,000 Chestnut Hill house that Philadelphia's Mayor Frank L. Rizzo moved into last week has reportedly been improved by perhaps more than $300,000 worth of work, attracting the attention of a special grand jury investigating municipal...
results.lead_paragraph: The $90,000 Chestnut Hill house that Philadelphia's Mayor Frank L. Rizzo moved into last week has reportedly been improved by perhaps more than $300,000 worth of work, attracting the attention of a special grand jury investigating municipal corruption. Mayor Rizzo, a career police officer who says his only income is from his $40,000 salary and investments he made from savings, has reportedly turned over his financial records to the grand jury.

results.abstract: Late Pres Johnson's former press see Bill Moyers, asked about Doris Kearns's statement that Pres Johnson once said he loved her and even proposed marriage, says he would not be surprised at all; says it would surprise him if Johnson meant what Kearns heard; says Johnson 'was given to stretching the truth' (S)

headline.main: Notes on People; Astronaut to Seek Senate Seat

results.snippet: Government, and particularly Congress, needs people who understand science "to properly place technological issues in the context of other national issues," said Harrison H. Schmitt, the astronaut, announcing his decision yesterday to seek the...
results.lead_paragraph: Government, and particularly Congress, needs people who understand science "to properly place technological issues in the context of other national issues," said Harrison H. Schmitt, the astronaut, announcing his decision yesterday to seek the Republican nomination for Senator from New Mexico, his home state.

results.abstract: Eastern Air Lines vp Frank Borman says carrier probably will need $38-million to $40-million in loans, in addition to previous $202-million, for purchase of 6 L-1011 jetliners (S)

headline.main: People and Business; Singer's President Takes Leave

results.snippet: The financially troubled Singer Company announced yesterday that Donald P. Kircher, its 60-year-old president and chairman, has taken an indefinite leave of absence from the company because of ill health.
results.lead_paragraph: The financially troubled Singer Company announced yesterday that Donald P. Kircher, its 60-year-old president and chairman, has taken an indefinite leave of absence from the company because of ill health.

headline.main: Army Nerve Experiments As Late as 1974 Reported

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept 12 The former chief of the Army's drug testing program disclosed today that the Army was experimenting on soldiers with a potent, incapacitating psychochemical known as BZ until as recently as later last year. As in the Army's LSD...

byline.original: By JOSEPH B. TREASTER Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept 12 The former chief of the Army's drug testing program disclosed today that the Army was experimenting on soldiers with a potent, incapacitating psychochemical known as BZ until as recently as later last year. As in the Army's LSD tests, he said, the subjects were never told what they were to receive or exactly how it might affect them.

results.abstract: Slayton comments on physical impossibility of signing autographs for Soviet citizens because of heavy turnout of well-wishers (S)

headline.main: An Astronaut Complains Of Mobs on Soviet Trip

results.snippet: VOLGOGRAD, U.S.S.R., Sept. 28 (UPI)--Five Ameri- can and Soviet spacemen who linked up in Earth orbit in July are getting so mobbed wherever they stop on a  goodwill tour of the Soviet Union that one of the Ameri- cans complained about it to- day.
results.lead_paragraph: VOLGOGRAD, U.S.S.R., Sept. 28 (UPI)--Five Ameri- can and Soviet spacemen who linked up in Earth orbit in July are getting so mobbed wherever they stop on a goodwill tour of the Soviet Union that one of the Ameri- cans complained about it to- day.
